pullrequest.title: Add tutorials for hardware / simulation bridging (#337)

content.raw:
That's correct.  You can't compile either package without an existing installation of the AtlasRobotInterface SDK, which is shared by BDI with teams and with OSRF via box.net (ask @hsu for access).  See the `README` file in each package for what to do if you have the SDK.

Of course, even given the SDK, you can't test `atlas_interface_bridge` without an actual robot.  You could test `atlas_interface`, by writing a program that uses the AtlasRobotInterface API; there's a minimal example in `atlas_interface/examples`.
content.html:
That's correct. You can't compile either package without an existing installation of the AtlasRobotInterface SDK, which is shared by BDI with teams and with OSRF via box.net (ask @hsu for access). See the README file in each package for what to do if you have the SDK.

Of course, even given the SDK, you can't test atlas_interface_bridge without an actual robot. You could test atlas_interface, by writing a program that uses the AtlasRobotInterface API; there's a minimal example in atlas_interface/examples.
